channel.title: David Goodger's Weblog
channel.description: Artima Weblogs is a community of bloggers posting on a wide range of topics of interest to software developers.

item.title: Go see "Speed Racer" -- what a blast!
item.description: A couple weeks ago I saw Speed Racer with my wife and kids. Lots of fun was had by all in this action-packed animé brought to hyper-real life.

item.title: Unicode misinformation
item.description: It's great that Google is moving to Unicode 5.1 and that UTF-8 is so popular, but I wish they'd get their terms straight!

item.title: Polyform Puzzler Talk Video (Montreal Python)
item.description: Video of my February 7 talk at the Montreal Python users group meeting is now up on the web. It was a lot of fun, and the group seemed to enjoy it too.

item.title: Python 3000 podcast interview with DDJ
item.description: An interview I did recently with Mike Riley of Dr. Dobb's Journal has been released: http://www.ddj.com/architect/205918857 (click through for a live hyperlink).

item.title: Slides/Handout for "Code Like A Pythonista: Idiomatic Python" Available
item.description: The materials for the tutorial I presented at PyCon 2007 and OSCON 2007 are now available on my website (with links).

item.title: PyCon Update
item.description: What I'll be doing at PyCon 2007 ("Idiomatic Python" tutorial, Docutils sprint), and a reminder of the early-bird registration deadline.

item.title: PyCon 2007: Call for Topics and Session Idea Feedback
item.description: In which your humble narrator ponders what to speak about and asks for community input.

item.title: Crippled By DRM & An 800-Pound Gorilla
item.description: How a new digital audio player required the application of techno-geek skills to obtain full as-advertised functionality. A notorious monopoly seems to be the culprit. Gee thanks, Bill!

item.title: Mickey’s Infinite Copyright
item.description: One of my graphics was recently featured in a BoingBoing story and is now available as a sticker. This is the story behind that graphic.

item.title: A Puzzling Divertimento
item.description: The Polyform Puzzler project was begun to scratch an old itch. After a long delay, the project was finally launched and is now maturing nicely. Interested parties are welcome to join in!

item.title: Python For Dummies
item.description: The latest book to be published in the "For Dummies" series covers Python. I'm proud to have played a small part in its production.

item.title: PyCon TX 2006 (Part 1) & A Return to the Blogosphere
item.description: The first in a series of articles about PyCon TX 2006, which marks my first blog entry in quite a while.

item.title: Refactoring reminiscent of high school algebra
item.description: A refactoring exercise tickles an old memory and triggers a new connection

item.title: A Week at PyCon DC 2004
item.description: A narrative account of my week at PyCon in Washington DC

item.title: How I Became The Perverted Singularity
item.description: And how you can become one, too... or discover that you already are
